Row.Text: Adjust the Screen, Subtitles and Input
Adjust the HUD, Autosaves and Time of Day Settings
Adjust the Quality and Performance of Civilization.
Adjust the Interface, Camera and Touch Settings
Are you sure you want to revert any changes that were made?
Revert all changes to the default settings.
Are you sure you want to revert to the default settings?
Reset most settings to their original defaults.

One or more changed options will cause the game to reload briefly to show the changes. You will not lose your place, but you may need to restart any actions that are in progress. Do you wish to proceed?
One or more changed options will not take effect until the game is restarted.
Your system configuration has changed. Options will refresh and you will lose any changes made.
Changes some game colors to help players with one of the three common forms of colorblindness.
Changes how long a mouse click or screen touch can be held down before movement is taken into account. If clicks/touches aren't reliably handled by the game, higher values can help.
Calibrate how bright the screen appears
Configure what is to be considered the safe area for the screen to be drawn.
Set the screen size for the safe area.
Make sure the outline is visible.
Everything inside of the lines will be shown for gameplay.
Select at which size you want text to be displayed.
Adjust the size of user interface elements.
Scale up the size of the user interface at high display resolutions.
Automatically speak the text under the mouse cursor when hovered.
The amount of time in milliseconds before hovered text is spoken.
Automatically speak multiplayer chat messages when they are received.
Optimizes the viewing experience based on what you are using to display the game.
Shows subtitles during voiced cinematic sequences.
How large the text is for subtitles.
What color is used in the text for subtitles.
How strong of a border is around the subtitle text.
Select how transparent is the background for subtitle text.
Use an external screen reader to read text out load.
Use the built in Windows Narrator to read text out load.
Specify the language used by the narrator.
Volume control for all sounds in the game. All other volume values are relative to master volume.
Loudness of leaders and advisors in the game.
The loudness of user interface elements such as using a button.
The loudness of sound effects such as ambient sounds and unit movements.
The loudness of audio during cinematics.
Dynamic Range - the difference in volume between the loudest and quietest sounds.
Mutes Civilization VII's audio when you click on another application's window.
Largest Dynamic Range - suggested for high-end sound systems or quiet environments.
Medium Dynamic Range - this is generally the best setting for most players.
Smallest Dynamic Range - all sounds are heard at low volume, in noisy environments, or by speakers limited in range.
Toggle using quick animations to resolve combat.
Toggle using quick movement for units moving across tiles.
Block ending a turn of a ranged attack from a city can be performed.
Turn on the modding tuner. This will disable achievements.
After all other turn blocking actions have been taken, cycle through units with movement points remaining.
After expending all movement points for the selected unit, cycle through units with movement points remaining.
After placing a building to construct, you will be returned to the production panel.
Toggles the information displayed in a Settlement's building Production menu.
Displays a building's base yield type(s) and building tags.
Displays the potential maximum total yields received when placing a building.
How many levels of detailed, tutorial information you'd like to receive while playing the game.
No Tutorials. Advisors will inform you if something is at risk.
Learn as you play. Warnings are also enabled.
Enables the first time tutorial when launching the game.
Show the first time player instructions at the start of a game.
No Tutorials. Advisors will inform you if something is at risk.
Learn as you play. Warnings are also enabled.
Learn as you play. Warnings are also enabled. If changed, you will need to start a new game with this setting to see Tutorials.
Which types of help to display during the gameplay.
Play multiplayer with players on other platforms.
The number of turns between which an autosave will be made.
The number of autosaves which are retained for the current game.
Shows promotional content from the Civilization team.
Select the graphics hardware used to render the game (requires restart).
Select windowed or full screen display.
Selects the resolution of the game. In windowed mode this will determine the size of the window, while in fullscreen mode the game will be stretched to fill the entire screen.
Enable vertical sync to avoid screen tearing.
Enable High Dynamic Range display (requires restart).
This container is an example of how the UI will look in game. Use this as a reference on how the UI will be affected by the UI Brightness levels.
Adjust the settings to the top emblem is not visible and the middle square is barely visible.
Selects advanced graphics options based on target quality level. Using these profile options is recommended for users not familiar with advanced graphics options.
Selects upscaling and/or anti-aliasing mode. Upscaling allows 3D rendering at a lower resolution, increasing performance. Anti-aliasing reduces flickering and produces a smoother image.
Enable AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution 1 Anti-aliasing and Upscaling
Enable AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution 3 Anti-aliasing and Upscaling
AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution 3 uses high-quality image upscaling to generate high resolution frames at fast frame rates.
Enable MetalFX Temporal Anti-aliasing and Upscaling
Enable Intel XeSS Anti-aliasing and Upscaling

Intel Xe Super Sampling (XeSS) technology uses machine learning to deliver higher performance with exceptional image quality. Hardware accelerated XeSS is optimized for Xe-HPG microarchitecture-based GPUs.
Intel Xe Super Sampling (XeSS) technology uses machine learning to deliver higher performance with exceptional image quality.
Intel Xe Low Latency Frame Rate Control
AI-generated frames are interlaced between existing graphics output to significantly increase the number of frames per second (FPS) and boost performance.
NVIDIA DLSS uses AI to boost frame rates while maintaining great image quality and responsiveness. This feature requires a GeForce RTX graphics card.
Super Resolution boosts frame rates by rendering fewer pixels and using AI to output high resolution frames.This feature requires a GeForce RTX graphics card.
NVIDIA DLAA is an AI-based anti-aliasing mode to improve image quality. This feature requires a GeForce RTX graphics card.
Make edges appear smoother. Higher sample counts look better while lower ones run faster and use less memory.
Set the quality level for AMD FSR1. Higher quality levels look better, while lower ones run faster.
Set the quality level for AMD FSR3. Higher quality levels look better, while lower ones run faster.
Ultra Performance mode provides the highest performance gain while still maintaining an image quality representative of native rendering.
Performance mode provides an image quality similar to native rendering with a major performance gain.
Balanced mode offers an ideal compromise between image quality and performance gains.
Quality mode provides an image quality equal or superior to native rendering with a significant performance gain.
Native AA mode provides an image quality superior to native rendering with a modest performance cost.
Set the quality level for Intel XeSS. Higher quality levels look better, while lower ones run faster.
Improves overall gaming performance the most.
Delivers optimal performance and image quality.
Delivers very high quality visual upscale.
Delivers the highest quality visual upscale.
Set the quality level for NVidia DLSS. Higher quality levels look better, while lower ones run faster.
Selects the best DLSS Mode for the current output resolution.
Offers the highest performance boost. Recommended for 8K gameplay only.
Offers a higher performance boost than balanced mode.
Offers both optimized performance and image quality.
Offers higher image quality than balanced mode.

Provides higher image quality with an AI-based anti-aliasing technique. DLAA uses the same Super Resolution technology developed for DLSS, reconstructing a native resolution image to maximize image quality.
Set the quality level for MetalFX Spatial. Higher quality levels look better, while lower ones run faster.
Delivers optimal performance and image quality.
Delivers very high quality visual upscale.
Set the quality level for MetalFX Temporal. Higher quality levels look better, while lower ones run faster.
Delivers optimal performance and image quality.
Delivers very high quality visual upscale.
Set the desired level of sharpening on the image.
Set the quality level for AMD FidelityFX Ambient Occlusion.
Selects the detail level for 3D objects in the game. High will use more detailed objects, while low will use simpler, less detailed objects.
Selects the quality level for Particle Effects like fires and smokes. High means more particles with more detailed motions, while low means less particles and runs faster.
Enable reflections of 3D objects in the game.
Enables screen space shadows. This provides an extra level of detail for shadows.
Enables screen-space overlay. Increases detail for 3D overlays such as culture and movement borders.
Enables bloom. Mimics the way some camera sensors work by causing bright areas on the screen to bleed into their surrounding area.
Selects texture detail level. Higher levels have more detail on objects, while lower levels use much less memory.
Selects shadow quality. Higher levels provide more detailed shadows, while lower levels are faster and use less memory.
Enables point light shadows in the foreground.
Selects shadow quality for foreground point lights. Higher levels provide more detailed shadows, while lower levels are faster and use less memory.
Select water rendering quality. High has more waves and enables refraction, while low runs faster.
Some applied changes require an application restart to take effect.
HDR is not available on this device.
This options is only available in the main menu.
Cannot be set with the current configured graphic options.
Cannot be set with the current screen mode.
Cannot be set with the current game resolution.
Cannot be set with the current GPU selected.
This option cannot be modified while in game.
Choose which language is used for audio and text.
Show the introduction video at startup.
How real-world time is formatted in the game's system panel.
Scale up the entire user interface.
What size mini-map do you want in your HUD?
How many seconds to wait before showing a tooltip on the user interface.
How many seconds to wait before showing a tooltip on the world tiles.
Warn about compatibility issues when loading MODs.
Use compatible 3rd party RGB lighting with game.
Always show the players yields in the HUD ribbon.
Keep the mouse within the game's window region.
Set the speed of the mouse wheel.
Replace the drag-and-hold functionality with click, drag and dropping.
How fast the camera moves when panning.
Automatically pan the camera to the next turn blocking notification.
When the cursor is moved to the edge of the game window, it will automatically pan the camera.
How much friction to apply to the camera when panning it with the analog stick.
Limits the map cursor to 6-directional movement.
Maximum speed of the map cursor.
How quickly the map cursor will move more than one hex.
Should input from touch be enabled in the game.
This device is not configured to accept touch input.
Affect the delay in tooltip when using touch.
If the trigger effect function is enabled in game.
Enable or disable the controller's rumble feature.
Adjust the settings to the top emblem is not visible and the middle square is barely visible.
Founders Edition Fog of War Tiles
